page.title: 18FRUIT FARMING
page.content: Th area in the south western half of the survey block lies in a shallow hollow facing south. This plus the light sandy soil makes it a particulary good area for fruit growing. The westerly edges of the fruit growing area can easily be identified by the tall rows of poplars and alders grown as windbreaks. The easterly edges are afforded some protection by the chalk escarpment. Mockbeggar Farm lies in the centre of the area. At Mockbeggar they grow some 70,000 fruit trees. They grow some eight different varieties of apples such as Bramley,Laxton,Granny Smith and Worcester and three different types of pears,Cornice,William and Conference. They also grow a number of varieties of plums eg.Margery Seedling. Also in the orchards can be seen Mayless or crab apple trees.
